headline.main: Australian Jones Set to Be Appointed England Coach-Reports
headline.print_headline: Australian Jones Set to Be Appointed England Coach-Reports

docs.snippet: Australian Eddie Jones is expected to become England's first foreign rugby union head coach with an official announcement imminent, British media reported on Thursday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Australian Eddie Jones is expected to become England's first foreign rugby union head coach with an official announcement imminent, British media reported on Thursday.

headline.main: How the Dow Jones Industrial Average Fared on Thursday
headline.print_headline: How the Dow Jones Industrial Average Fared on Thursday

docs.snippet: U.S. stocks ended slightly lower on Thursday after a day of mostly listless trading as investors weighed a mixed slate of corporate earnings and outlooks. Health care stocks were among the biggest decliners after UnitedHealth Group cut its full-ye...
docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. stocks ended slightly lower on Thursday after a day of mostly listless trading as investors weighed a mixed slate of corporate earnings and outlooks. Health care stocks were among the biggest decliners after UnitedHealth Group cut its full-year earnings forecast. Payments company Square and online dating site operator Match Group soared in their market debuts.

headline.main: Airbus A380 Upgrade May Come Later Than 2022: CEO
headline.print_headline: Airbus A380 Upgrade May Come Later Than 2022: CEO

docs.snippet: Airbus believes introducing a sales-boosting upgrade to its A380 aircraft in 2022 may be too early, Chief Executive Fabrice Bregier said at an industry gathering in New York on Thursday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Airbus believes introducing a sales-boosting upgrade to its A380 aircraft in 2022 may be too early, Chief Executive Fabrice Bregier said at an industry gathering in New York on Thursday.

headline.main: U.S. Prosecutors in Talks With Finance Director in U.N. Bribe Case
headline.print_headline: U.S. Prosecutors in Talks With Finance Director in U.N. Bribe Case

docs.snippet: U.S. prosecutors have disclosed that they are in talks that could lead to a plea deal with a New York-based foundation's finance director who was accused of participating in a scheme to bribe a former United Nations General Assembly president....
docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. prosecutors have disclosed that they are in talks that could lead to a plea deal with a New York-based foundation's finance director who was accused of participating in a scheme to bribe a former United Nations General Assembly president.

headline.main: Louisiana Rivals for Governor Criticize Jindal Deficit Plan
headline.print_headline: Louisiana Rivals for Governor Criticize Jindal Deficit Plan

docs.snippet: Both men vying to follow Gov. Bobby Jindal into office lambasted the governor's plan for closing the state's $487 million budget deficit, saying Thursday the proposal papers over the gap in a way that punts the problem to the next governor....
docs.lead_paragraph: Both men vying to follow Gov. Bobby Jindal into office lambasted the governor's plan for closing the state's $487 million budget deficit, saying Thursday the proposal papers over the gap in a way that punts the problem to the next governor.

headline.main: Suriname Devalues Currency, Sparking Inflation Fears
headline.print_headline: Suriname Devalues Currency, Sparking Inflation Fears

docs.snippet: This South American country has devalued its currency by more than 20 percent, with officials blaming a drop in world prices for the oil and gold that sustain the economy....

headline.main: Some Ex-NFL Players Seek to Re-Work $1 Billion Concussion Settlement
headline.print_headline: Some Ex-NFL Players Seek to Re-Work $1 Billion Concussion Settlement

docs.snippet: Lawyers representing some former NFL players urged a federal appeals court on Thursday to scrap the league's $1 billion concussion settlement because it does not cover potential victims of a degenerative brain disease linked to repeated blows to t...
docs.lead_paragraph: Lawyers representing some former NFL players urged a federal appeals court on Thursday to scrap the league's $1 billion concussion settlement because it does not cover potential victims of a degenerative brain disease linked to repeated blows to the head.
